comments.body: Cool but I am not sure how this would be implemented. What if their was a mode called realistic mode with this in it, along with thirst bar and stuff.

JakeZulu it's very simple to implement, mojang shouldn't be afraid to make the game better. I didn't suggest this to make the game more realistic but instead to make it a better game with more replayability and this too helps multiplayer interaction become better. If there are too many modes it's harder for people to choose and it will split communities.

I say go with a little bit of both positive and negative, but add more dimensions to crop growth than just the biome it's in. Farming is really easy right now and it needs some challenge. For example, the growth of each plant could be influenced by:

  • The biome/dimension
  • The altitude
  • Sky access and/or type of lighting
  • The season (if added)

Some plants would be affected more by certain factors than others. Under very good conditions, crops would be slightly more efficeint than they are now. Under poor conditions, crops would grow slower and give poorer yields. Under bad conditions, crops might even die. For example, some crops might grow more efficiently if given sky access, but also be more succeptible to freezing in a taiga biome or during winter when exposed to the sky.

I agree: we barely have any weather in Minecraft. It would be interesting to see a weather state in which damage is done, like if there was a tornado it takes away some of your houses blocks and drops them somewhere else. And you could add fog where the air turns a little bit whiter/grayer and makes it so that you can't really see that well. This could happen after rain or snow. And maybe falling hail, since it's ice, could hurt you? Also for the tornado, it could sweep you away to somewhere else? And maybe having mobs or animals seek shelter whenever there is some kind of snow/rain/tornado/fire/flood etc.

YES! I love weather and would love to see much more interesting weather in Minecraft than just boring basic rain thunder and snow. I want to see fog, high winds that make it difficult to move down wind and maybe even push you when your standing still when gusts of heavy wind hits you, flooding would be cool if doable. Hail would be awesome, maybe it could damage you a little if you donâ€™t have a helmet on or a shield for cover.

Is this inspired by the springs of Yellowstone National Park? If so perhaps literal yellowstone and mud of mud pots would be more fitting for a geothermal feature; magma blocks are simply smelted boulders in volcanic sites, and yellowstone is caused by extremophilic bacteria in action. Also can you explain the idea behind bees? I'm confused as to why this is a utopia for bees.
